DataElement.preferredName: Gender Adjusted Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Symptom Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A gender-adjusted score for the chronic Graft versus Host Disease (GVHD) patient symptom assessment, calculated as the total score for the assessment divided by the number of evaluated components. [Note: for females, total score is divided by 8; for males, total score is divided by 7.]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gender Adjusted Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Symptom Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Assessment tool used to capture symptoms of patients with chronic Graft vs. Host Disease (GVHD)._Gender is the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles._The act of making necessary corrections or modifications._A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Gender Adjustment Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Gender is the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.:The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.:A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics of people that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex. As a social construct, gender varies from society to society and can change over time. (Adapted from WHO.)
The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.

A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
